cpt_description: MRI, any joint of lower extremity, without contrast
policy_source: UTAH MEDICAID PROGRAM — PRIOR AUTHORIZATION CLINICAL CRITERIA, Section 2: COVERAGE CRITERIA
curator_notes: Human curation applied after LLM compilation. Fixed critical conservative treatment requirement_type from 'all' to 'count_gte' with threshold 2. Added special populations section for age-specific requirements (under 18, 65+). Restructured prior imaging section for clarity. Enhanced denial prevention tips with 10 specific scenarios. Enhanced submission reminders with procedural details. Improved help_text throughout for clinical findings and conservative treatment items to include specific documentation requirements.

checklist_sections.title: Eligible Diagnosis
checklist_sections.description: Member must have a documented diagnosis from one of the following categories
checklist_sections.help_text: Check the member's medical record for a diagnosis that meets the criteria

items.label: Suspected Osteochondral Lesion
items.help_text: ICD-10: M93.2xx

checklist_sections.title: Clinical Findings
checklist_sections.description: At least one of the following clinical findings must be documented on physical examination within 30 days prior to the PA request
checklist_sections.help_text: Check the member's medical record for a clinical finding that meets the criteria

items.label: Positive McMurray's Test (or Thessaly test)
items.help_text: Must be explicitly documented as 'positive' (not 'equivocal' or 'deferred'). Must be documented within 30 days of PA request date. Exam note must include examiner name and date.

items.label: Joint line tenderness + mechanical symptoms
items.help_text: Document location (medial/lateral joint line) AND associated mechanical symptoms (locking, catching, or giving-way). Tenderness alone without mechanical symptoms does NOT meet this criterion.

items.label: Persistent Joint Effusion
items.help_text: Documented persistent joint effusion present for more than 4 weeks

items.label: Positive Lachman Test (or anterior/posterior drawer)
items.help_text: Must be explicitly documented as 'positive' (not 'equivocal'). Include which test was performed and degree of laxity if documented. Must be within 30 days of PA request.

items.label: Instability on Varus or Valgus Stress Testing
items.help_text: Documented instability on varus or valgus stress testing

items.label: Restricted Range of Motion
items.help_text: Documented restricted range of motion with a documented mechanical block

checklist_sections.title: Prior Imaging Requirement
checklist_sections.description: Weight-bearing radiographs (X-rays) of the affected knee must be completed within 60 calendar days prior to the date of the MRI prior authorization request
checklist_sections.help_text: Confirm X-rays were completed recently and report is available. Minimum 2 views required (AP and lateral); 3 views preferred.

items.label: X-rays of affected knee completed
items.help_text: Weight-bearing AP view required unless contraindicated. If non-weight-bearing views were used, document the specific contraindication. X-ray report must be available in medical record and included with PA submission.

detail_fields.label: Date of X-rays (must be within 60 days)

checklist_sections.title: Conservative Treatment Requirement
checklist_sections.description: Member must have completed a minimum of six weeks of conservative therapy with at least TWO of the following treatment modalities
checklist_sections.help_text: Document at least 2 of the following 5 treatments. Total duration must be at least 6 weeks (42 days). Multiple treatments may be done concurrently.

items.label: Physical Therapy (≥6 sessions over ≥6 weeks)
items.help_text: Minimum 6 PT sessions with licensed physical therapist over at least 6 weeks total. PT notes must include: dates of service for each session, treatment techniques used, and functional status assessments. 'Patient saw PT' without specific dates and session count will be denied.

items.label: NSAIDs or oral analgesics (≥4 weeks)
items.help_text: Document: medication name, dose, frequency, and duration (minimum 4 weeks). If NSAIDs contraindicated (renal insufficiency, GI bleeding history), document contraindication reason and alternative analgesic used.

items.label: Activity modification + home exercise program
items.help_text: Document specific activity restrictions AND home exercise program. Must include what activities were modified and what exercises were prescribed. Duration should align with 6-week minimum conservative care period.

items.label: Bracing, orthotics, or assistive devices
items.help_text: Document type of device used (knee brace, orthotics, cane, crutches) and duration of use. Include prescription or recommendation documentation if available.

items.label: Intra-articular injection
items.help_text: Document: injection date, medication type (corticosteroid or hyaluronic acid), medication name, and patient response to injection. Include procedure note if available.

checklist_sections.title: Special Population Requirements
checklist_sections.description: Additional requirements for specific age groups (under 18 or 65+)
checklist_sections.help_text: If the member is under 18 OR 65+, check the applicable section. If member is age 18-64, check the standard adult population box.

items.label: Member under 18 - Pediatric orthopedic evaluation
items.help_text: REQUIRED for members under 18: Evaluation by board-certified or board-eligible pediatric orthopedic surgeon, including growth plate (physeal) assessment. Include evaluation documentation with PA.

detail_fields.label: Growth plate assessment included in evaluation?

items.label: Member 65+ - Surgical candidacy assessment
items.help_text: REQUIRED for members 65+: Document functional impact on activities of daily living (ADLs) and whether member is a surgical candidate. If NOT a surgical candidate, must document how MRI will directly modify non-surgical management plan.

detail_fields.label: If NOT surgical candidate: How will MRI modify non-surgical management?

items.label: Member age 18-64 (standard population)
items.help_text: No special requirements for this age group

exception_pathways.title: Acute Traumatic Injury Exceptions
exception_pathways.description: The 6-week conservative treatment requirement is waived when any of the following exception criteria are documented
exception_pathways.help_text: Check the member's medical record for documentation of an acute traumatic injury

items.label: Acute Traumatic Injury
items.help_text: Documented acute traumatic injury with inability to bear weight at the time of evaluation

items.label: Suspected Complete Rupture of a Major Ligament
items.help_text: Documented suspected complete rupture of a major ligament (ACL, PCL, MCL, LCL) based on clinical examination

items.label: Clinical Findings Consistent with Displaced Meniscal Tear
items.help_text: Documented clinical findings consistent with displaced meniscal tear (locked knee) — documented inability to achieve full extension

exception_pathways.title: Post-Operative Exception
exception_pathways.description: The 6-week conservative treatment requirement is waived when post-operative evaluation is required within 6 months of knee surgery
exception_pathways.help_text: Check the member's medical record for documentation of a post-operative evaluation

items.label: Post-Operative Evaluation
items.help_text: Documented post-operative evaluation required within 6 months of knee surgery

items.label: Surgical Date
items.help_text: Documented surgical date

items.label: Operative Report Reference
items.help_text: Documented operative report reference

exception_pathways.title: Red Flag Exception
exception_pathways.description: The 6-week conservative treatment requirement is waived when red flag symptoms are present
exception_pathways.help_text: Check the member's medical record for documentation of red flag symptoms

items.label: Suspected Joint Infection
items.help_text: Documented suspected joint infection (septic arthritis) — fever, elevated inflammatory markers, turbid joint aspirate

items.label: Suspected Primary or Metastatic Tumor
items.help_text: Documented suspected primary or metastatic tumor of bone or soft tissue

items.label: Suspected Occult Fracture
items.help_text: Documented suspected occult fracture not visualized on X-ray

exclusions.title: No Clinical Indication
exclusions.description: MRI knee without contrast is not covered when there is no clinical indication or symptoms — routine screening

exclusions.title: Isolated Anterior Knee Pain
exclusions.description: MRI knee without contrast is not covered when there is isolated anterior knee pain (patellofemoral syndrome) without mechanical symptoms or instability

exclusions.title: Mild Osteoarthritis
exclusions.description: MRI knee without contrast is not covered when there is mild osteoarthritis and no surgical planning is intended

exclusions.title: Worker's Compensation Injury
exclusions.description: MRI knee without contrast is not covered when the injury is a worker's compensation injury — must be billed to WC carrier

exclusions.title: Member Declines Surgical Intervention
exclusions.description: MRI knee without contrast is not covered when the member declines surgical intervention regardless of MRI findings — unless MRI results will directly modify non-surgical management plan

exclusions.title: Repeat MRI within 12 Months
exclusions.description: MRI knee without contrast is not covered when there is a repeat MRI within 12 months without documented change in clinical status, failed intervention since prior imaging, or pre-operative planning requirement

denial_prevention_tips: ISOLATED anterior knee pain alone (patellofemoral syndrome) without mechanical symptoms → automatic denial. Must document locking, catching, or giving-way if present.
Repeat MRI within 12 months → denied unless you document: (1) change in clinical status since prior MRI, (2) failed intervention since prior imaging, OR (3) pre-operative planning need.
Conservative treatment documentation must include SPECIFIC DATES and DURATIONS. 'Patient tried PT' without session dates will be denied. PT notes must show at least 6 sessions with dates of service.
McMurray's test or Lachman test documented as 'equivocal' or 'uncertain' does NOT meet the clinical findings requirement. Must be explicitly documented as POSITIVE.
X-rays must be weight-bearing views unless contraindicated. If non-weight-bearing views were used, document the specific contraindication (e.g., unable to bear weight due to acute injury).
NSAIDs trial must document: medication name, dose, frequency, and duration (minimum 4 weeks). If NSAIDs contraindicated, document reason and alternative analgesic used.
For members 65+, surgical candidacy assessment is REQUIRED. If member is not a surgical candidate, must document how MRI will directly modify the non-surgical management plan.
Workers' compensation injuries must be billed to the WC carrier, NOT Utah Medicaid. Medicaid will deny.
Member declines surgery → MRI denied UNLESS you document that results will directly change non-surgical treatment approach (e.g., modify PT protocol, adjust bracing).
For members under 18, pediatric orthopedic evaluation is REQUIRED. Evaluation must be by board-certified or board-eligible pediatric orthopedic surgeon and include growth plate assessment.
submission_reminders: Authorization valid for 60 calendar days from approval date. If imaging not completed within 60 days, must submit new PA.
Processing times: Standard 3-5 business days, Expedited 72 hours (requires clinical justification), Emergency same-day by phone (1-800-662-9651).
Submission methods: Electronic via medicaid.utah.gov/pa-portal (preferred), Fax 1-801-555-0100, Phone 1-800-662-9651 (M-F 8am-5pm MT).

REQUIRED documentation checklist: (1) Clinical notes from within 30 days including exam findings, (2) Conservative treatment records with dates and outcomes, (3) X-ray report dated within 60 days, (4) ICD-10 code(s), (5) Statement of medical necessity and treatment plan impact.

For exceptions: Include specific documentation (e.g., for acute trauma: ED report showing inability to bear weight; for post-op: surgical date and operative report reference; for red flags: lab results, cultures, imaging).
For special populations: Under 18: Include pediatric orthopedic evaluation documentation. Age 65+: Include surgical candidacy assessment and functional impact statement.
Incomplete submissions cause delays or denials. Review Section 5 of policy document before submitting.
Denials may be appealed per Utah Medicaid Fair Hearing procedures (Utah Admin. Code R414-301 et seq.).
For urgent/emergent cases: Call 1-800-662-9651 and request expedited review. Be prepared to provide clinical justification for urgency.
